comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b13pre) Gecko/20110301 Firefox/4.0b13pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b13pre) Gecko/20110301 Firefox/4.0b13pre

On Windows 7, when you Ctrl+click on the Firefox icon, the current tab change randomly to another one (including other tab groups and other windows). The Ctrl+click should un-minimize the last opened Firefox Windows and show the last viewing tab. It un-minimizes the windows correctly.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open a few tabs.
2.Ctrl+click on the icon in the taskbar.
Actual Results:  
Current tab change randomly to another one.

Expected Results:  
Current tab should not change.

Aero is enabled.
comments.creator: alpha_delta@live.com
comments.author: alpha_delta@live.com

comments.raw_text: I forget to mention that you have to enable Taskbar Preview.

comments.author: andrei.domuta@softvision.ro
comments.text:
Works for me on:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b13pre) Gecko/20110313 Firefox/4.0b13pre

*Note although the issue may refer to using windows instead of tabs. Here are the STRs:

1. Open 2 or more firefox windows 
2. CTRL+click on the firefox taskbar icon.

Expected result
2. The visible firefox window should minimize

Actual result:
2. If CTRL+click there is only a switching between windows. none of it is minimized
comments.creator: andrei.domuta@softvision.ro
